title: Rendering a list in a react
content:
Hello,
In this article, we will learn how to render lists in React.
To render the list, use the map function provided by the JavaScript array.

comments.content: When I develop it, I think I use a lot of map functions😄
Now that I've applied it, the code is very simple
You have to put in the key
It feels like your productivity is going up

title: What is conditional rendering of a reaction?
content:
Hello,
In this article, we will learn about conditional rendering of the react.
Conditional rendering literally means rendering differently depending on the condition.

comments.content: There was a way to use it like this!
Thank you for the good tip
I've always used ?, but now I'm going to use &&.
Thank you for the easy explanation😁
I'll use it to the code right away!

title: Shall we learn about React Hook?
content:
Hello,
In this article, we will learn about React's Hook.
Hook interrupts the flow of the functional components of the react and uses them to handle various tasks.

comments.content: It was a difficult concept, but I think it was organized a little after reading the article.
I was wondering what Hook was doing, and it was like this. Thank you for the information.
When I first heard the hook, it was so hard. Thank you!👍
I think I can use it well from now on
It is too hard😂

title: Introducing the React Component Concept
content:
In this article, I would like to explain the components of React.
I'm sure all of you who have studied react a little bit know that react is component-based
So what are the components?

comments.content: It's great to be able to understand the confusing concepts
Thank you for an explanation of the components👏
I just used the components without really understanding them, and it's great that I can definitely get the concept!👍
React is based on components, so it's reusable and really good
React is the best!👍
